author: Thidawan Tunya
title: Bristol Bar Mixologists Share Libation Inspiration At Cocktail Couture: Mixology Art, A Special Four Seasons Hotel Boston Masterclass On October 1
text:
Email 
Just in time for Boston’s Fashion Week and Fall ArtWeek 2015, Four Seasons Hotel Boston presents Cocktail Couture: Mixology Art, a special masterclass led by mixologists from the Hotel’s popular Bristol Bar, exploring cocktail inspiration from the worlds of art and fashion. 
Part of the brand-wide Four Seasons initiative Entertain U(niversity) this October, the special interactive cocktail workshop at Four Seasons Hotel Boston is one offering in a wide-ranging series of global educational consumer classes, workshops and experiences led by in-house event planners, culinary teams and beverage masterminds held within versatile event spaces at Four Seasons hotels and resorts around the world. 
Cocktail Couture: Mixology Art takes participants behind the scenes at the Bristol Bar, exploring how mixologists develop inspired cocktails. Led by Four Seasons experts, the interactive, engaging 1.5 hour masterclass celebrates Boston’s Fashion Week and Fall ArtWeek 2015 by looking to the worlds of fashion and art for libation inspiration. 
Mixologists will look to signature pieces from the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston collections and leading fashion designers for inspiration. Under the guidance of Four Seasons experts, participants explore recipes, garnishes, colour and vessels in crafting exquisitely creative cocktails. 
Participate in the educational journey on the Entertain U(niversity) online home on Taste by Four Seasons and follow the #FSEntertainU hashtag on Instagram, Facebook and Twitter to uncover the schedule of expert-led classes , take a peek at the most extraordinary Four Seasons event venues and discover tips of the trade fromFour Seasons culinary and event experts. What: Cocktail Couture: Mixology Art Date: October 1, 2015 Time: 5:00-6:30 pm Location: Bristol Bar at Four Seasons Hotel Boston, 200 Boylston Street, across from the Boston Public Garden Cost: USD 50 per person Reservations: Call 617 351 2205 to reserve a space; class is limited to a maximum of 20 participants; reservations are non-refundable Share this:
